Description: THE PROJECT WILL BRING THE EXISTING CATENARY SYSTEM ASSETS INTO A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR WITH THE REPLACEMENT OF APPROXIMATELY 215 OCS STRUCTURES FROM APPROXIMATELY MP 8.5 TO APPROXIMATELY MP 16.6. THE HELL GATE LINE IS USED BY AMTRAKS NEC SERVICES AND FREIGHT, AND THE PROJECT WILL INCREASE RELIABILITY AND RESILIENCE OF THE ELECTRICAL TRACTION SYSTEM FOR THE CURRENT INTERCITY PASSENGER RAIL SERVICES. REPLACING THE CATENARY STRUCTURES WILL ALSO REDUCE RISKS OF FUTURE STRUCTURAL FAILURES THAT WOULD CAUSE PASSENGER DELAYS.

THE PROJECT WILL MODIFY 40 HORIZONTAL CURVES BETWEEN YPSILANTI, MI AND JACKSON, MI, IMPROVE SAFETY TO PUBLIC AND PRIVATE AT GRADE CROSSINGS TO ACHIEVE HIGHER SPEEDS AND REDUCE ONE WAY TRIP TIMES. ALSO, THE PROJECT WILL INSTALL APPROXIMATELY 80,000 LINEAR FEET OF NEW CONTINUOUS WELDED RAIL (CWR), WHICH WILL FURTHER ASSIST IN INCREASING RAIL SPEEDS.

THE PROJECT FUNDS AMTRAK TO SUPPORT THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE PORTAL NORTHBRIDGE PROJECT. THE EXISTING PORTAL BRIDGE WILL BE REPLACED WITH A MODERNSTRUCTURE THAT DOES NOT NEED TO SWING OPEN TO ALLOW FOR PASSING MARITIMETRAFFIC, AND RESTORES RELIABILITY AND STATE OF GOOD REPAIR TO THIS CRITICALSEGMENT OF THE NORTHEAST CORRIDOR. REPLACING THE BRIDGE WITH A NEW FIXED,HIGH LEVEL STRUCTURE WILL ELIMINATE THE RISK OF FURTHER DELAYS ANDMALFUNCTIONS OF THIS CRITICAL RAIL INFRASTRUCTURE ASSET.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO REHABILITATE TRACK, STRUCTURES, AND GRADE CROSSINGS IN VENTURA COUNTY AND NORTHERN LOS ANGELES COUNTY ON INFRASTRUCTURE USED BY AMTRAK INTERCITY SERVICE, METROLINK COMMUTER SERVICE, AND FREIGHT SERVICE.

THE PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT TRACK AND SIGNAL IMPROVEMENTSBETWEEN MILEPOST (MP) 9 AND MP 143 ON THE STATE OF MICHIGANOWNED SEGMENT OF THE CHICAGO TO DETROIT PONTIAC CORRIDOR TOMAINTAIN A STATE OF GOOD REPAIR AND PRESERVE THE CAPABILITY TOOPERATE PASSENGER TRAIN SPEEDS UP TO 110 MPH.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONSTRUCT TRACK BED STABILIZATION AND SEISMIC IMPROVEMENTS ALONGTHE ERODING BLUFFS THAT WILL ENHANCE SAFETY AND MAINTAIN RAIL SERVICE ALONG THE LOS ANGELES-SANDIEGO-SAN LUIS OBISPO (LOSSAN) RAIL CORRIDOR. THE IMPROVEMENTS WILL PROTECT THE TRACK BED BYDESIGNING AND CONSTRUCTING A COMBINATION OF IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDING NEW STRUCTURAL STABILIZATIONELEMENTS, REPAIR AND REINFORCEMENT OF EXISTING STRUCTURAL ELEMENTS, SURFACE AND SUBSURFACE DRAINAGEIMPROVEMENTS, SURFACE EROSION CONTROL AND SLOPE STABILIZATION, AND REPAIR OF EXISTING ACCESS ROADS FORCONTINUED MAINTENANCE AND MONITORING OF THE BLUFFS. THIS PROJECT WILL ENABLE THE DEL MAR BLUFFS TOREMAIN IN STABLE CONDITION AND, IN TURN, MAINTAIN A RELIABLE RUNNING RAILROAD THAT PRESERVES THE CRITICALSAN DIEGO TO SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA CONNECTION FOR PASSENGER AND FREIGHT RAIL TRANSPORTATION.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE SERVICE RESILIENCY AND CAPACITY ALONG THE HARRISBURGLINE BETWEEN FRAZER AND THORNDALE. THE CURRENT STATE OF THE INFRASTRUCTURE RENDERS TRACK 2ALONG THE HARRISBURG LINE VIRTUALLY UNUSABLE BECAUSE OF THE DETERIORATED CONDITION AND RESULTINGSPEED RESTRICTIONS. THE RESULTING RESTRICTION IN MOVEMENT CREATES CONGESTIONS ON THE OTHERTRACKS OF THE HARRISBURG LINE. THE PROJECT WILL RESTORE TRACK 2 TO AN FRA CLASS 3 STANDARD WITHRULE 562 IN-CAB, NO-WAYSIDE BI-DIRECTIONAL SIGNALING. UPON COMPLETION, SEPTA TRAINS ARRIVINGAT AND LEAVING FROM FRAZER YARD WILL TRAVEL EXCLUSIVELY ON TRACK 2 FOR NON-REVENUE SERVICE. THEPROJECT WILL INCREASE CAPACITY AND REDUCE CONGESTION ON AMTRAK?S KEYSTONE CORRIDOR, REDUCENON-REVENUE MOVEMENT TIMES FOR SEPTA, AND REDUCE TRAVEL TIMES FOR NORFOLK SOUTHERN.

THESE COMPREHENSIVE INFRASTRUCTURE UPGRADES WILL IMPROVE THE FREQUENCY,CONVENIENCE AND RELIABILITY OF PASSENGER RAIL SERVICES AND OVERALL SYSTEM SAFETY ANDSTATE OF GOOD REPAIR BOTH AT UNION STATION AS WELL AS THROUGHOUT THE WORCESTERCOMMUTER RAIL LINE. IT WILL IMPLEMENT ACCESSIBILITY RETROFITS TO BRING PATHS OF TRAVELINTO COMPLIANCE WITH AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA) CODE REQUIREMENTS,REDUCE OPERATION SCHEDULES, REDUCE STATION LIFE CYCLE MAINTENANCE COSTS, LOWERENERGY CONSUMPTION AND PROVIDE CAPACITY EXPANSION OPTIONS TO MEET CURRENT ANDFUTURE DEMAND.
SAN DIEGO NEXT GENERATION SIGNALING AND GRADE CROSSING MODERNIZATION PROJECT
HUDSON AVENUE GRADE CROSSING REHABILITATION AND SAFETY IMPROVEMENTS
